...泛在华南地区华北地区上海加锋电子最常见的开关是让人操作的机电设备，其中有一个或数个电子接点。接点的“闭合”（closed）表示电子接点导通，允许电流流过；开关的“开路”（open）表示电子接点不导通形成开路，不允许电流流过.

entry.tran: 封闭的；不接受新人（或新思想）的
entry.def: A closed group of people does not welcome new people or ideas from outside.

example.ex: It was to be a closed circle of no more than twelve women...
example.tran: 它本来应该是一个不超过12名女性的封闭的小圈子。

example.ex: It is a closed society in the sense that they've not been exposed to many things.
example.tran: 他们接触的事不多，从这一方面来说这是个封闭的社团。

means.word_mean: 1. not open or affording passage or access;

sentences.sentence: "the many closed streets made travel difficult"
"our neighbors peeped from behind closed curtains"

means.word_mean: 2. of a curve or surface; having no end points or boundary curves; of a set; having members that can be produced by a specific operation on other members of the same set; of an interval; containing both its endpoints
4. used especially of mouth or eyes;

sentences.sentence: "his eyes were shut against the sunlight"

means.word_mean: 7. not open to the general public;

sentences.sentence: "a closed mind unreceptive to new ideas"

means.word_mean: 10. (of the wings of birds and insects) closed together

sentences.sentence: "the airport is closed because of the weather"

Sentence.sentence: Mr Jobs had a reputation as a control freak （怪人）, and his critics complained that the products and systems he designed were closed and inflexible, in the name of greater ease of use.

Japanese listeners sometimes closed their eyes to enhance concentration

sentences.cn: 她感到灼热的泪水在紧闭的眼中涌动。

sentences.en: The balcony was closed with bars.

sentences.en: I’m afraid geophysics is rather a closed book to me.
